subject: Programming
title: The Birth of Version Control
description: Learn The Birth of Version Control in one minute.

hook.text: Before version control, programmers overwrote each other's files. Last save wins. Chaos ensued.

buildup.text: SCCS appeared in 1972, letting teams track who changed what and when in a shared codebase.

discovery.text: Version control meant mistakes could be undone. Any previous state could be restored with a command.

twist.text: Early systems locked files â€” only one person could edit at a time. Collaboration was still painful.

climax.text: CVS and later Git solved this with merging. Parallel work became possible and changed everything.

punchline.text: Undo for code changed how teams build software.

quiz.question: What problem did version control solve?
